description: Adapted from Qiagen's genomic DNA handbook and the user protocol for mosquito DNA extraction.

groups.group_name: MinION user group for high molecular weight DNA extraction from all kingdoms

status_info: This has been tested with Argentine Stem Weevil, but grinding time should be optimised for other insects.

components.data:
Place insects in a 1.7 mL tube with two 3.2 mm steel balls (RNase-free).

 

Snap freeze in liquid nitrogen.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Place insects in a 1.7 mL tube with two 3.2 mm steel balls (RNase-free).

 

Snap freeze in liquid nitrogen.

source_data.reagent_name: 3.2 mm stainless steel beads, RNase free

components.data:
The goal of this step is to pulverise the insects without allowing them to thaw. Grinding time requires optimisation to balance DNA yield against physical damage to the DNA.

 

Grind insects using a Retsch mixer mill MM 400 / Qiagen TissueLyser or similar with blocks pre-cooled in liquid N2 for 90 seconds at 20 Hz.

 

After grinding, immediately return the tubes to liquid nitrogen. Ground samples can be stored at -80°C until you're ready to continue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
The goal of this step is to pulverise the insects without allowing them to thaw. Grinding time requires optimisation to balance DNA yield against physical damage to the DNA.

 

Grind insects using a Retsch mixer mill MM 400 / Qiagen TissueLyser or similar with blocks pre-cooled in liquid N2 for 90 seconds at 20 Hz.

 

After grinding, immediately return the tubes to liquid nitrogen. Ground samples can be stored at -80°C until you're ready to continue.

components.data: Prepare the lysis buffer by adding 1.5 µL of RNase A (100 mg/mL) to 1438.5 µL of Buffer G2 per sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare the lysis buffer by adding 1.5 µL of RNase A (100 mg/mL) to 1438.5 µL of Buffer G2 per sample.

components.data: Add 60 µL of Proteinase K (20 mg/mL) and incubate with inversion at 50°C for 2 hours.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 60 µL of Proteinase K (20 mg/mL) and incubate with inversion at 50°C for 2 hours.

components.data: Remove the powdered sample from liquid nitrogen or the -80°C freezer and immediately add 1440 µL of lysis buffer from step 3.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the powdered sample from liquid nitrogen or the -80°C freezer and immediately add 1440 µL of lysis buffer from step 3.
Incubate for 30 minutes at 37°C with inversion.

components.data: Centrifuge at max speed for 20 minutes to pellet the debris. Using a P1000, slowly pipette 1200 µL of the supernatant into a 15 mL Falcon tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at max speed for 20 minutes to pellet the debris. Using a P1000, slowly pipette 1200 µL of the supernatant into a 15 mL Falcon tube.

components.data: Dilute the lysate to around 3 mL. The volume doesn't matter, but if the sample is more dilute it will run through the column faster.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute the lysate to around 3 mL. The volume doesn't matter, but if the sample is more dilute it will run through the column faster.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 8 of HMW DNA extraction for insects
source_data.annotation: Dilute the sample by adding buffer G2 to the required volume.
source_data.thread_text: Dilute the sample by adding buffer G2 to the required volume.
source_data.body: Dilute the sample by adding buffer G2 to the required volume.

components.data: Equilibrate a QIAGEN Genomic-tip 20/G with 1 mL Buffer QBT. Wait for the Genomic-tip to drain by gravity. You can do this during step 7.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Equilibrate a QIAGEN Genomic-tip 20/G with 1 mL Buffer QBT. Wait for the Genomic-tip to drain by gravity. You can do this during step 7.

components.data: Carefully apply the lysate to the Genomic-tip. Don't vortex the sample. Gently invert it a few times to mix it, then pour as much as you can from the 15 mL tube into the Genomic-tip. Pulse spin the 15 mL tube to collect any remaining lysate, and slowly pipette it into the Genomic-tip with a P1000. Wait for the Genomic-tip to drain by gravity. All of the draining steps can take a long time, and this step is particularly slow if the sample is viscous (30–60 minutes), but resist the urge to apply positive pressure.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully apply the lysate to the Genomic-tip. Don't vortex the sample. Gently invert it a few times to mix it, then pour as much as you can from the 15 mL tube into the Genomic-tip. Pulse spin the 15 mL tube to collect any remaining lysate, and slowly pipette it into the Genomic-tip with a P1000. Wait for the Genomic-tip to drain by gravity. All of the draining steps can take a long time, and this step is particularly slow if the sample is viscous (30–60 minutes), but resist the urge to apply positive pressure.

components.data:
Wash the QIAGEN Genomic-tip with 1 mL Buffer QC.

 

Repeat this step 3 times for a total of 4 mL of Buffer QC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Wash the QIAGEN Genomic-tip with 1 mL Buffer QC.

 

Repeat this step 3 times for a total of 4 mL of Buffer QC.

components.data: Elute the DNA into a new 15 mL tube with 2 mL of Buffer QF. Wait patiently for the tip to drain.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Elute the DNA into a new 15 mL tube with 2 mL of Buffer QF. Wait patiently for the tip to drain.

components.data:
After elution I split the sample into three because our lab doesn't have a fast centrifuge for 15 mL tubes.

 

Slowly pipette 667 µL of the eluate into three clean 1.7 mL tubes with a P1000. Add 467 µL of room-temperature isopropanol to each tube, mix by inversion about 10 times, and centrifuge for 20 min at 15,000g at 4°C to pellet DNA
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
After elution I split the sample into three because our lab doesn't have a fast centrifuge for 15 mL tubes.

 

Slowly pipette 667 µL of the eluate into three clean 1.7 mL tubes with a P1000. Add 467 µL of room-temperature isopropanol to each tube, mix by inversion about 10 times, and centrifuge for 20 min at 15,000g at 4°C to pellet DNA

components.data: The pellet can be hard to see at this point. Slowly pour off the supernatant. I usually keep the supernatant from this step and the ethanol wash until I've tested the final yield of my preps. Pulse spin the tubes, and remove any remaining traces of supernatant with a P10.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: The pellet can be hard to see at this point. Slowly pour off the supernatant. I usually keep the supernatant from this step and the ethanol wash until I've tested the final yield of my preps. Pulse spin the tubes, and remove any remaining traces of supernatant with a P10.

components.data:
Add about 1 mL of ice-cold, 70% ethanol. Invert a few times, and centrifuge at 15,000g for 10 min at 4°C. Pour off the ethanol, pulse spin the tubes, and remove any remaining traces of ethanol.

 

Repeat this step once for a second wash with 70% ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Add about 1 mL of ice-cold, 70% ethanol. Invert a few times, and centrifuge at 15,000g for 10 min at 4°C. Pour off the ethanol, pulse spin the tubes, and remove any remaining traces of ethanol.

 

Repeat this step once for a second wash with 70% ethanol.

components.data: Air dry the pellet briefly. It can be difficult to resuspend, so don't leave it too long. I try to get all the drops of ethanol with a P10, and then watch the tubes until the traces evaporate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Air dry the pellet briefly. It can be difficult to resuspend, so don't leave it too long. I try to get all the drops of ethanol with a P10, and then watch the tubes until the traces evaporate.

components.data:
Resuspend each pellet in 55 µL of Qiagen EB (Tris-Cl pH 8). Don't pipette the sample up and down to resuspend it. Leave the tubes overnight at room temperature with inversion to resuspend.

 

Resuspention volume is up to you, but if you're doing a MinION run, this leaves you around 5 µL for QC.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Resuspend each pellet in 55 µL of Qiagen EB (Tris-Cl pH 8). Don't pipette the sample up and down to resuspend it. Leave the tubes overnight at room temperature with inversion to resuspend.

 

Resuspention volume is up to you, but if you're doing a MinION run, this leaves you around 5 µL for QC.

components.data:
Visualise 1 µL of sample to estimate the molecular weight. We don't have PFGE or a TapeStation / Fragment Analyzer, so I use 0.7% Agarose.

 

Quantify your sample with a Qubit. If you're using the HS kit, you may have to dilute the sample 1:10.

 

Analyse 1 µL in a UV spectrophotometer (e.g. Nanodrop).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Visualise 1 µL of sample to estimate the molecular weight. We don't have PFGE or a TapeStation / Fragment Analyzer, so I use 0.7% Agarose.

 

Quantify your sample with a Qubit. If you're using the HS kit, you may have to dilute the sample 1:10.

 

Analyse 1 µL in a UV spectrophotometer (e.g. Nanodrop).

components.data:
This gel shows 10 samples extracted with this method. Each sample is one third of a single sample that was run through a Genomic-tip and split into three at the precipitation stage. Each original sample was a pool of 20 adult Argentine stem weevils (Coleoptera: Curculionidae). DNA extractions from these insects with other methods have resulted in low 260/230 ratios.

 

 

 

 

0.7 % Agarose in TBE, run at 80 V for 60 minutes and post-stained for 30 minutes in 0.1 mg / mL EtBr. We ran 1 µL of each sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
This gel shows 10 samples extracted with this method. Each sample is one third of a single sample that was run through a Genomic-tip and split into three at the precipitation stage. Each original sample was a pool of 20 adult Argentine stem weevils (Coleoptera: Curculionidae). DNA extractions from these insects with other methods have resulted in low 260/230 ratios.

 

 

 

 

0.7 % Agarose in TBE, run at 80 V for 60 minutes and post-stained for 30 minutes in 0.1 mg / mL EtBr. We ran 1 µL of each sample.

components.data:
We used all of sample 8 for a library prep with the Oxford Nanopore SQK-LSK108 kit. At the end of the prep we recovered 1536 ng of DNA. We loaded the whole library onto a R9.4.1 flowcell and ran it for 40 hours.

 

Here are some metrics from the basecalling:
